events.name: Friends of PyDataSG @ Google - Big Data and Machine Learning Festival
events.description: RSVP @ http://bit.ly/bigdata-ml-festival Google is hosting Big Data and Machine Learning Festival on June 23 in Singapore. Hear a recap of the key announcements on Google Cloud Platform in the past year and learn about its Big Data and Machine Learning offerings from Googlers and industry leaders. In celebration of Google Cloud Singapore Data Center's first year, we'd also like to take the opportunity meet with IT professionals, developers, startups and enthusiasts of Google Cloud and celebrate Google’s #CloudFirst commitment to the region. Look forward to a celebratory occasion and connect with like-minded folks! RSVP here: bit.ly/bigdata-ml-festival ---------------------------------------Agenda AgendaTime Program13:00 Registration13:30 Opening Keynote13:40 Cloud for Startups: GCP credits and what is in it for your startup?13:50 Wego’s Data Journey with GCP14:10 Tea Break14:30 BigQuery and Visualisation on Data Studio15:00 Power Up Your Chatbot with AutoML + Dialogflow15:40 Closing • Important to knowRSVP @ http://bit.ly/bigdata-ml-festival
events.location: 11 Eunos Road 8,,  #05-03 , Lifelong Learning Institute, 408601, Singapore

events.name: Data Science Summit 2018: Harness the Full Potential of Data Science
events.description: OverviewThe Data Science Summit is an annual event bringing together the data science community in Singapore, and discuss ways to harness the full potential of data science and machine learning. The agenda is suited to guide you through the process of extracting knowledge from data by using the latest methodologies, tools and algorithms. Agenda13:30 – 14:00: Registration14:00 – 14:05: Opening14:05 – 14:30: Keynote 1: Building Data Products for Operational Impact14:30 – 14:55: Keynote 2: Leveraging on Machine Learning and AI14:55 – 15:20: Keynote 3: From Old School to New School: the Evolution of Data Science15:20 – 15:45: Keynote 4: How Data Science Multiplies E-Commerce Sales15:45 – 16:30: Panel Discussion - Harness the Full Potential of Data16:30 onwards: Networking Speakers and ModeratorAllen Zhou, ex-CRM Data & Analytics Manager at UberAllen is a cross-disciplinary data professional with more than six years of experience working in a diverse range of domain areas including Tech, Investment Banking, and Wealth Management; leveraging his knowledge in Machine Learning, Deep Learning, CRM Analytics, Investment Analytics, Business Intelligence, Financial Modelling, Company Valuation, and Portfolio Management. Troy Palanca, Senior Data Analyst, Lead (Data Science / Driver) at UberTroy is the Sr Data Analyst (Data Science / Driver Growth & Experience) at Uber Asia Pacific, managing end-to-end data science workflows from problem definition all the way to decision, action, or production; as well as leading a team of analysts in their own deliveries, ultimately changing the way Asia Pacific moves and thrives. Shannon Chan, Data Scientist at CarousellShannon is a Data Scientist at Carousell. He helped to kickstart and build up the Data Team in Carousell, now including data analysts for product teams and business intelligence. Currently, he focuses building predictive models with TensorFlow and Cloud ML services for Ads Targeting and Search in Carousell. Prior to Carousell, he was with Nitrous.IO at Silicon Valley for a year as part of NUS Overseas College. Sylvain Truong, Data Scientist at SephoraSylvain joined Sephora Digital as a Data Scientist to build smart e-commerce products. His main interests lie in recommendation engines, marketing attribution modelling, cloud architectures and tensorflow. Previous to that, Sylvain earned his MSc. degrees from ENS Paris Saclay and Mines ParisTech, with a final dissertation on text-to-speech synthesis. Dr. Tony Jin, CEO at BestTopTony is the CEO of BestTop and alumni of the world's largest startup accelerator - Founder Institute. Prior to BestTop, he worked as Graduate Trainee in the Royal Bank of Singapore. He received his PhD from the National University of Singapore. He researched innovation management and published several papers in leading academic journals. His work won the Literati Network Awards for Excellence 2013 award.

events.name: Deploy and Manage Applications on Kubernetes
events.description:
Containers are a great way to deploy multiple applications with different and often conflicting requirements on a server. They do this by running the application inside a virtualized operating system. However as your fleet of containers grow, you’ll find that managing them becomes a chore.
Kubernetes is container orchestration platform for managing containers; it performs tasks like restarting containers if they die, route request to appropriate application, migrate persistent volumes, schedule rolling updates, etc.
This workshop is broken into 2 segments; in the first segment, we will build a simple application and illustrate how to containerize that application.
The second part of this workshop, will focus on how to use Kubernetes to deploy and manage the application.

*Stay in touch  with the latest from us! Sign up to receive emails on new courses, upcoming seminars, updates and more.
